PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Agfa Superpan Supreme safety film
CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 6, 1941, pg. 10, reads: "Glamorous Scenes as Society Turns Out To See "Aida" - Highlight of the National Association of Musicians' convention in Pittsburgh was the performance of the great opera, "Aida" by an entire Negro cast... Ms. May Beegle, local promoter of concerts, was present. Said she enjoyed the performance... - Photos by Harris and Lewis."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of May Beegle, local concert promoter, wearing flowered hat and fur stole standing in hallway of Syria Mosque for National Negro Opera Company performance of "Aida"
